title: Hawaiian Ham and Cheese Sliders Recipe
description: The best Hawaiian sliders with ham, cheese, sweet rolls, and a buttery poppy seed sauce. These are great for potlucks and quick and easy to prepare.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE More Meal Ideas Mini Foods Main Dishes Slider Recipes Hawaiian Ham and Cheese Sliders 4.8 (214) 157 Reviews 46 Photos Hawaiian sliders are great for potlucks for something fun and easy to share. Submitted by Susan Gee Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 46 46 46 46 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 sliders Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings cooking spray (such as Crisco®) ½ cup butter 1 onion, minced 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard 1 tablespoon poppy seeds 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, or more to taste 1 (12 count) package Hawaiian sweet rolls, split, or more as needed 1 pound sliced deli ham, or more as needed 8 slices Swiss cheese, or more as needed Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat; cook and stir onion in the melted butter until softened, 5 to 10 minutes. Add mustard, poppy seeds, and Worcestershire sauce; cook and stir for 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange the roll bottoms in the prepared baking dish. Spoon 2/3 of the onion mixture over top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add ham and cheese to each roll. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place the roll tops over the cheese layer, then brush the remaining onion mixture over top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover the dish with aluminum foil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove aluminum foil and bake until the roll tops are lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 734 home cooks made it! I added Provalone, shredded Gouda, and Dijon mustard.
